DataElement.preferredName: BK Virus Infection Hemorrhagic Cystitis Symptom Onset Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date of symptom onset when supportive care medication for BK virus cystitis began.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: BK Virus Infection Hemorrhagic Cystitis Symptom Onset
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An infection caused by the BK virus. It usually causes an asymptomatic infection, except in immunocompromised individuals where it may cause nephropathy or hemorrhagic cystitis._Inflammation of the bladder resulting in bloody urine._The point at which the symptoms began or were first noted.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An infection caused by the BK virus. It usually causes an asymptomatic infection, except in immunocompromised individuals where it may cause nephropathy or hemorrhagic cystitis.

Concepts.definition: An infection caused by the BK virus. It usually causes an asymptomatic infection, except in immunocompromised individuals where it may cause nephropathy or hemorrhagic cystitis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0519249 - BK and CMV qns curation 9.11.20

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.
